---
title: "Table One Long"
---

This vignette goes over the creation of a Table One Long object using the 
bllFlow library. This object can then be exported as a CSV file, PDF for manuscripts
etc.

Table One Long gives summary statistics on the model variables, based on the
data used in the model development.

All the steps below will use the PBC dataset and the relevant model worksheets.

Step 1: Initialize a bllFlow R object
``` {R}
# Install the survival model and load it as a library
install.packages("survival")
library(survival)

# Load the data from the PBC dataset
data(pbc)
# Read in the MSW and variable_details sheet for the PBC model
MSW <- read.csv(file.path(getwd(), 'inst/extdata/PBC/PBC MSW.csv'))
variable_details <- read.csv(file.path(getwd(), 'inst/extdata/PBC/PBC variable details.csv'))

# Create a bllFlow R object for the PBC model using the above variables as args
pbc_model <- bll_flow(pbc, MSW, variable_details)
```

Step 2: Create a Table One Long object
```{R}
# Import the CSV file which describes how to make the table one long object
table_one_specs <- read.csv(file.path(getwd(), 'inst/extdata/PBL/PBC Table Specs.csv'))
# Create the table one long object
table_one_long <- MakeTableOneLong(pbc_model, table_one_specs)

# Print it
print(table_one_long)
```
